channel.title: Coding?
channel.description: Would Python be the best Programming language to start off with? What are your thought & what do you think the best language to start with is ?

item.title: Coding?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Echo_, post:5, topic:446030”]Learning Pascal/Object Pascal is also a good option, it’s how I got started and is incredibly easy to understand (it was created with teaching in mind). Another plus is that it compiles directly to native code rather than being interpreted like Java and Python. The only problem is there isn’t as many examples and tutorials compared to more popular languages.[/quote]lolol

Read full topic

item.title: Coding?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Well if you want a language that you plan to use after you’ve got a good grasp on programming, choose python, java, or even c++.

Read full topic

item.title: Coding?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Echo_:

Learning Pascal/Object Pascal is also a good option, it’s how I got started and is incredibly easy to understand (it was created with teaching in mind). Another plus is that it compiles directly to native code rather than being interpreted like Java and Python. The only problem is there isn’t as many examples and tutorials compared to more popular languages.

I’d rather have cat aids, thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Coding?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Learning Pascal/Object Pascal is also a good option, it’s how I got started and is incredibly easy to understand (it was created with teaching in mind). Another plus is that it compiles directly to native code rather than being interpreted like Java and Python. The only problem is there isn’t as many examples and tutorials compared to more popular languages.

Read full topic

item.title: Coding?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

python is a pretty decent language and has fairly simple syntax. it can be scripted via the python shell and comes with an editor (albeit a bad one). for someone with little experience with programming, python definitely is friendly enough to work with.

Read full topic

item.title: Coding?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Do whatever sounds and looks interesting to you, if you start off with something you don’t like, then it will be harder to learn, at least for me. But I’d suggest you look into Java, it’s simple, easy to start with, and has tons of documentation and examples.

Read full topic
